repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Allow the first channel connected or stdio to unblock remote_ui_wait_for_attach

See #25706 for discussion

Close #25706

comment_data.body: this looks a bit racy, what if it takes time for the `--listen` connection to be made and it gets stuck waiting on `CHAN_STDIO` ? We should detect the condition of `--embed --listen` from command parsing, and in that case, accept an `nvim_ui_attach` on _any_ channel.
No, we don't know what 3 is going to be at all (this code is not written just for the `--listen` usecase).

Ok, i can see that - there's definitely a race on first channel. Theres an issue in that the numbers of the listen channels aren't allocated until connect. So I'm not quite sure how to loop on a wait for a ui connect - other than that I could avoid checking for specific channels and instead check if any ui connected. However the event streams are channel specific. I assume it would be possible to loop all channels in a listen block - maybe that the right approach rather than serially polling specific ones?
in that case you would watch the main event queue `main_loop.events`. This will implicitly include all rpc channels as child queues.
What's the cleanest way to pass that info into nvim_ui_attach from your pov? Right now I have it such that nvim_ui_attach always accepts a connection on any channel
great! Made that mod.  Thanks

What I mean is - would it be ok to add an arg to nvim_wait_for_ui_attach or would that be changing the api in an undesirable way. 

Happy to clean up the commit comment and make whatever changes. 

I have a fork of vimr nearly up and running cleanly st. It can talk to a more or less stock nvim with this change.
`embedded_mode` is implied so only the `(params.listen_addr != NULL)` condition is necessary.
revert
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -83,3 +83,5 @@ tags
 /contrib/result-*
 
 CMakeUserPresets.json
+/.build

comment_data.body: cool, fixed.
Remove this line. If it hangs below what should be done is to change the `:request()` to `:notify()` for `nvim_ui_attach`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -133,3 +136,51 @@ describe('--embed UI', function()
     ]]}
   end)
 end)
+
+describe('--embed --listen UI', function()
+  it('waits for connection', function()
+    clear ()
+    local child_server = assert(helpers.new_pipename())
+
+    -- attach immediately after startup, for early UI
+    local screen = thelpers.screen_setup(0,
+      string.format(
+        [=[["%s", "--embed", "--listen", "%s", "-u", "NONE", "-i", "NONE", "--cmd", "%s"]]=],
+        helpers.nvim_prog, child_server, helpers.nvim_set))
+    --screen.rpc_async = true  -- Avoid hanging. #24888

comment_data.body: This comment is also wrong here.
removed the comment
removed the rpc_async comment

@@ -133,3 +136,49 @@ describe('--embed UI', function()
     ]]}
   end)
 end)
+
+describe('--embed --listen UI', function()
+  it('waits for connection', function()
+    clear ()
+    local child_server = assert(helpers.new_pipename())
+
+    local screen = thelpers.screen_setup(0,
+      string.format(
+        [=[["%s", "--embed", "--listen", "%s", "-u", "NONE", "-i", "NONE", "--cmd", "%s"]]=],
+        helpers.nvim_prog, child_server, helpers.nvim_set))
+    screen:expect{grid=[[
+      {1: }                                                 |
+                                                        |
+                                                        |
+                                                        |
+                                                        |
+                                                        |
+      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
+    ]]}
+
+    local child_session = helpers.connect(child_server)
+
+    local info_ok, apiinfo = child_session:request('nvim_get_api_info')
+    assert(info_ok)
+    assert(#apiinfo == 2)
+
+    child_session:request('nvim_exec2', [[
+      let g:vim_entered=0
+      autocmd VimEnter * call execute("let g:vim_entered=1")
+    ]], {})
+
+    -- vimenter shouldn't be set to 1 until after attach
+    local var_ok, var = child_session:request('nvim_get_var', 'vim_entered')
+    assert(var_ok)
+    ok(var == 0)
+
+    local attach_ok, _ = child_session:request("nvim_ui_attach", 10, 10, {})
+    ok(attach_ok)
+
+    -- vimenter should now be set to 1

comment_data.body: This is probably still incorrect, but I will fix it in another PR.

comment_regular_data.body:
What's needed here? I'm aware of:

- [x] A test needs writing
- [x] Comment needs lint cleaning
Just run `make format` for the second one

a test would be good. `new_pipename()` can be used to generate a safe name to use with `--listen` and then connect, compare `test/functional/api/buffer_updates_spec.lua` and `test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua`.

> a test would be good. `new_pipename()` can be used to generate a safe name to use with `--listen` and then connect, compare `test/functional/api/buffer_updates_spec.lua` and `test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua`.

Great! Added a test that checks VimEnter doesn't fire until after the attach.
The test seems to be indeed hanging on Windows. I'll push a commit to fix it.

> The test seems to be indeed hanging on Windows. I'll push a commit to fix it.

Thanks! Lmk if there's anything I need to do.

title: feat(server): allow embed with listen
